chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ion Butucea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

8:30am Court in session

Defendant Ion Butucea present in court, in custody with Attorney Keith Venema. DA Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Matter was set today for jury trial, parties have an agreement. Plea questionnaire filed by Atty Venema & Atty Venema puts agreement on the record. 

State is in compliance with victims rights, victim impact statement filed, no restitution requested. 

Court has plea colloquy with Deft.
Court gives warnings as to deportation, Deft acknowledges. 

Deft pleads guilty to amended information
22CF8

Ct #3: DC
Ct #4-Mis. Battery

22CM89
Ct #1- Poss THC

Deft does not wish to make statement

Ct #1 & #2 in 22CF8 are DRI

128 Days Walworth County Jail-Time Served
Costs, Fees & Surcharges
DNA Sample & Surcharge

8:39am Court in recess
Updated

Court in session at 229 pm. Appearances made. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Ion Butucea, in custody. Russian interpreter Andrew Derbentsev, duly sworn by clerk, appears. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Parties are prepared for trial. Offers conveyed. Discovery complete on the felony file. States 5 witnesses are available. Exclusion of witness subject to victim and court official. 2 alternates; 5 strikes. Jurors may take notes; no questions. Jury instructions Friday before. Cases are not being requested to be joined at this pint. Interpreter confirms in court reserved and available for trial dates.
Andrew Derbentsev
Demand by defendant

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ion Butucea appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Keith Kolby Venema appeared in court for Ion Butucea. Interpreter Andrew Derbentsev appeared for the defendant. Speedy trial demanded by defendant. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CF8 & 22CM89
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.M.P (dob 12-24-1981) OR DEPUTY B. STETTNER OR HIS FAMILY EXCEPT IN DEPUTY PROCEDURAL CAPACITY.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:04pm Court in session

Defendant Ion Butucea in court, in custody with sworn Romanian interpreter and attorney Brad Lochowicz for attorney Keith Kolby Venema.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State calls Deputy Brenton Stettner, duly sworn & testifies on direct by the State. 
Deputy Stettner identifies the Deft by where he's seated & what he's wearing, no objection by Atty Lochowicz. 
State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint, into evidence. 
No objection by Atty Lochowicz. Court receives exhibit #1.

2:08pm Cross-Exam by Atty Lochowicz. 
2:13pm State objects as to relevance. Response by Atty Lochowicz. Court will allow at this time. 
2:15pm Re-Direct by DA Wiedenfeld. 
2:15pm No re-cross. Deputy excused. 
State rests. 

Evidence is closed. 

State's argument, State asks for bind over. 
Atty Lochowicz's argument. 

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been commited & that the Deft likely commited it & binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
State has courtesy copy of criminal information, provides to defense. 

  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
